trans-unit.source: Represents a selectable item inside a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabControl"></xref>.
TabItem is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedContentControl>.
Its content property is <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content%2A> and its header property is <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedContentControl.Header%2A>.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedContentControl> class.
Customizing the TabControl Control To apply the same property settings to multiple TabItem controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the TabItem, see [TabControl Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
> [!NOTE] > Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in TabItem control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](../Topic/Customizing%20the%20Appearance%20of%20an%20Existing%20Control%20by%20Creating%20a%20ControlTemplate.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabItem"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabItem"></xref> is selected.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|, , |

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabItem"></xref> is selected; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabItem.IsSelected*> dependency property.
To be added.
Responds when an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.AccessText.AccessKey*> for a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TabControl"></xref> is called.
Provides data for <xref href="System.Windows.Input.AccessKeyEventArgs"></xref>.
Called when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl.Content*> property changes.
Old value of the content property.
New value of the content property.
Called when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabControl.ContentTemplate*> property changes.
Old value of the content template property.
New value of the content template property.
Called when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabControl.ContentTemplateSelector*> property changes.
Old value of the content template selector.
New value of the content template selector.

Provides an appropriate <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TabItemAutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this control, as part of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] automation infrastructure.
The type-specific <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation.
Responds to the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement.MouseLeftButtonDown"></xref> event.
Provides data for <xref href="System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs"></xref>.
Announces that the keyboard is focused on this element.
Keyboard input event arguments.
Called to indicate that the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabItem.IsSelected*> property has changed to <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
The event data for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.Selected> event.
Called to indicate that the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabItem.IsSelected*> property has changed to <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The event data for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Selector.Unselected> event.
Gets the tab strip placement.
This property cannot be set.
It gets its value from the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabControl.TabStripPlacement%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the parent <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabControl>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Dock"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Dock"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TabItem.TabStripPlacement*> dependency property.
To be added.
